column4: Hi, I upgraded from Warty to hoary recently and periodically since the upgrade my machine grinds to a halt.  I hadn't figured out why until just now I notices that top shows 0 k for swap (free or used).  My swap partition does not show up when I run df, though it is in my /etc/fstab.  Anyone know what's going on here and how I get my system to use my swap again?
Checking out the man page...  Any idea why the upgrade made it start ignoring the swap?
Hmmm...I gues I'll just try swapon -a and see what happens.
Ok, any idea how I set it to use the swap on boot?
if you go to applications > system tools > System monitor
does it say your using swap
is this just an ubuntu box?
Well, there's a version of Windows on here, though it's really just a vestigal appendage these days.
But as I said, this was working with warty.  The only thing that changed was I changed my repositories to hoary and upgraded.
